steps: Access CardioServer: From Epic → patient chart → CardioServer SmartLink/URL, or desktop icon, or Citrix Workspace → CardioServer. Enter AD username/password. Confirm Role = Tech User.
Find & Filter Studies: Worklist/Studies view → filter by Facility, Status (Preliminary, Unconfirmed, Confirmed, Stored), optional Date. Click Apply/Search.
Link Study to Patient/Order: Select study → Link to Order/Reconcile → search MRN/name → select patient & order → Save/Link.
Assign Provider: Open study → Provider/Assign field → type/select provider → Save/Update.
Trash/Restore Studies: Preliminary only. More Actions → Move to Trash. To restore: Trash view → Restore/Untrash within 30 days.
Manual Upload – ECG: Upload/Import → ECG Upload → Browse file → enter MRN → Upload → Link + Assign.
Manual Upload – Stress Test: Upload/Import → Stress Upload → Browse file → enter MRN → Upload → Assign.
Multi-Facility Workflows: Facility Filter → select 1+ sites → Apply.
Study Status Guide: Preliminary = new; Unconfirmed = pending review; Confirmed = signed; Stored = archived; Trash = deleted (30 days).
Resources: Help → User Manual → Tech role topics.

qa.q: What if a study doesn’t match any patient/order?
qa.a: Use Link to Order/Reconcile, search MRN/name, then select the correct order.

qa.q: Can I trash a study that’s already Unconfirmed?
qa.a: No — only Preliminary studies can be trashed.

qa.q: How do I restore a study I deleted?
qa.a: Go to Trash view, select study, click Restore/Untrash within 30 days.

qa.q: How do I upload an ECG manually?
qa.a: Upload → ECG Upload → Browse → enter MRN → Upload → Link → Assign.

qa.q: How do I know if a study is final?
qa.a: Status shows Confirmed once provider signs.

steps: Launch Consult: Epic MPage 'TV Kit Consults' or Converge website → select patient → Start Consult.
Accept Call: Bedside staff clicks Accept on TV Kit 200S → verify audio/video.
Provider Controls: Start/End video, screen share, chat.
Documentation: Enter consult note in Epic MPage → link to encounter.

qa.q: How do I start a consult?
qa.a: From Epic MPage 'TV Kit Consults' → select patient → Start Consult.

qa.q: What if patient can’t hear me?
qa.a: Check mute, device volume, and TV Kit connection.

qa.q: Can I use chat?
qa.a: Yes, available inside video window.

qa.q: Where do I document the visit?
qa.a: In Epic, under the Consult MPage note linked to encounter.

steps: Track Board Overview: Shows bed, name, age, complaint, acuity, staff initials. Hover for details.
Order Status Icons: Icons for EKGs, meds, labs, imaging. Columns: placed, in process, completed.
Registration & Disposition: Registration = checkmark/X; Disposition = patient destination.
Layout Customization: Drag-and-drop to rearrange columns.
Views: Side-by-side, summary, or magnifying glass for details.

qa.q: What does an X in registration mean?
qa.a: Registration incomplete. It won’t block discharge.

qa.q: How do I see pending labs?
qa.a: Check order columns: placed, in process, completed.

qa.q: Can I move columns?
qa.a: Yes — drag-and-drop to customize.

qa.q: How do I open triage workup report?
qa.a: Use side-by-side view or summary toggle.

steps: Specimen Collection: Check-in patient → enter orders → print labels → scan wristband/specimen → transport.
Receiving/Processing: Scan barcode → verify orders → add FYIs → cancel/redraw if needed.
Tech Workflow: Use Outstanding List → repeat tests → verify results → document criticals.
Send-Outs: Create packing list → add specimens → assign destination → mark ready/picked up.
Reports: Specimen Inquiry for status → print reports/labels.

qa.q: How do I reprint a specimen label?
qa.a: Use Order → Reprint Label.

qa.q: Where do I check pending tests?
qa.a: Use the Outstanding List.

qa.q: How do I batch send-outs at Holy Family?
qa.a: End-of-day packing list → send to Resurrection.

qa.q: How do I document a redraw?
qa.a: Cancel test → order redraw → collect new specimen.

steps: Login: Enter Epic credentials → confirm Department/Role.
Consent: Consent → e-Signature → select consent type → capture signatures. Refusal = print, ink, scan, send to HIM.
Specimen Labeling: Place order → print labels → scan wristband + specimen.
Orders: EKG → assign reviewing physician. Blood → order set → transfusion workflow.
Intra-Op: Use Sidebar Quick Events (In Room, Procedure Start, etc.).
Supply Management: Search item name/manufacturer. One-time supply if needed.
PACU: Enter dressing/laterality → add PACU comments.
Scheduling: Snapboard → service/surgeon/location → apply preference card.
Charge Capture: Charge Capture activity → select CPT → Save.
Device Data: Attach device (1 per workstation). PACU → disassociate at discharge.

qa.q: How do I substitute a signer on consent?
qa.a: Enter name + nurse witness.

qa.q: What if patient refuses e-signature?
qa.a: Print → ink signature → scan → send to HIM.

qa.q: How do I reprint specimen labels?
qa.a: From label screen → Reprint option.

qa.q: How do I start intra-op documentation?
qa.a: Sidebar Quick Events (In Room, Procedure Start).

steps: Navigation: My Lists → Storyboard → demographics, teams, labs.
Inbox & Fluency Direct: Communication and dictation tool.
Problem List & Orders: Add/update/resolve problems. Place/review orders.
Med Reconciliation: Admission, transfer, discharge.
Discharge: Review allergies/problems → reconcile meds → generate AVS.
Consultant Workflow: Create consult note → use speed buttons/smart phrases.
Surgery Workflow: Use Prep for Surgery navigator → enter consults/orders.

qa.q: Where do I reconcile meds?
qa.a: During admission and discharge.

qa.q: What if there’s a hard stop in an order set?
qa.a: It must be addressed before proceeding.

qa.q: How do consultants document?
qa.a: Consult note → use smart phrases or templates.

steps: Dashboard: In Basket messages, card status, occupancy.
Dispense: Prep, cart fill, compounding, repackaging.
Medication List: ADS tab for IID. Submit ticket if blank.
Custom Labels: Use smart text for efficiency.
Cart Fill: Reprint labels if not printed. Reroute printer if down.
Barcode Validation: Validate Cardinal meds. Handle NDC mismatches with tickets.
Verification Queue: Select mixture records, change bases, ticket missing records.
Patient’s Own Meds: Set charge method to 'no charge'. Dispense code = patient supply.

qa.q: How do I access tip sheets?
qa.a: Press F1 → Learning Home Dashboard.

qa.q: What if cart fill labels don’t print?
qa.a: Reprint manually via Dispense button.

qa.q: What if printer is down?
qa.a: Reroute jobs. Remove rerouted printers later.

qa.q: What if IID is blank?
qa.a: Submit ticket for IID assignment.

steps: Learning Home: Access tip sheets/resources via F1.
Dashboards: MA vs Physician dashboards. Includes Haiku setup.
Schedule & Status: Use full clinic schedule. Status column shows workflow updates.
SDOH: Review color-coded risk indicators in Storyboard.
Rooming: Set preferred lab for orders.
Screenings: Medicare wellness in screenings section. Custom via Flowsheets.
Navigator: Dual-pane 'This Visit'. Customizable for charge capture/problem list.
Charge Capture: Auto vs manual charges (meds, immunizations, tests, procedures).
Lab Orders: Status (normal/standing/future). Class (lab collect/clinic collect/external).
Referrals: Internal vs external. Missing provider? Use FIND tool.
MyChart: Nurse can send text/email code (14 days). Patients must re-enroll.
Telemedicine: Schedule visit type 'Telemedicine'. Providers join via Epic/Haiku.
In Basket & Pools: Staff check into pools. Pool names follow Prime standards.

qa.q: Where are tip sheets?
qa.a: Learning Home Dashboard via F1.

qa.q: What if MyChart sign-up missing?
qa.a: Confirm with team — it should be there.

qa.q: How do I activate MyChart?
qa.a: Send via text/email code (valid 14 days).

qa.q: How do I schedule telemedicine?
qa.a: Use Telemedicine visit type.

qa.q: What if provider missing in referrals?
qa.a: Enroll using FIND tool.
